data.title: Software Engineer
description: Designed and implemented a Java Spring Boot project to fetch stock data from various systems and convert it into user-requested formats, enhancing data accessibility and usability.
Deployed microservices on AWS EC2 instances for scalability and high availability, while utilizing Amazon S3 for efficient storage and retrieval of response files.
Employed PostgreSQL as the database solution to store customized configuration settings for the application, ensuring secure and efficient management of application configurations.
Used MongoDB database to efficiently manage structured and unstructured stock data, ensuring data integrity and flexibility.
Implemented Redis cache to optimize system performance by caching frequently accessed data, reducing database load and improving response times.
Utilized ActiveMQ for reliable message queuing and communication between microservices, enabling asynchronous processing and seamless data transfer.
Employed multithreading for parallel processing of stock data, enhancing system throughput and efficiency.
Leveraged Java Spark (Hadoop) for distributed computing and processing of high-volume data, supporting advanced analytics and insights generation.

Used Spring Security for authentication and authorization of users, Spring JDBC for easy database operations using JDBC template, writing row mappers and Spring Boot easy bootstrap applications from scratch.
Developed and executed test cases, test plans, and test scripts, employing testing frameworks such as JUnit and Karate to validate application functionality and performance.
Orchestrated Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using Jenkins and Git, automating build, test, and deployment processes to streamline software delivery.
